page.title: 15A gardener at Thorpe Court.
page.content: Mr Fowler travels from Sulgrave to Thorpe Mandeville to start work at 8.15 each morning.He waters the plants in three green-houses then he picks any vegetables that are needed in the house for meals that day.He goes back into the vegetable garden and weeds until lunch time when he has a break for half an hour. After lunch he spends time in the flower garden,planting,thinning,moving and weeding.Once a week he cuts the lawns.It takes all day.He uses a sit on mower and a small tractor. If it is wet he finds plenty of jobs to do in the greenhouses and sheds.Some vegetables like carrots and onions are stored in these sheds for the winter. At 4.45p.m.he returns home and after his supper he sometimes does jobs in his own garden.He keeps bees there.
